required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: From Structural to Functional Characteristics of the Lumbar Multifidus in Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: From Structural to Functional Characteristics of the Lumbar Multifidus in Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: To delineate the underlying mechanisms that contribute to chronic low back pain, by extending our knowledge on structural characteristics of the lumbar multifidus muscle using ultrasound muscle imaging, and by examining the association of structural features with functional performance, more precisely proprioceptive control.

primary_outcome.measure: Lumbar multifidus muscle volume measured by 3DfUS
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after inclusion in the study
primary_outcome.description: in patients with chronic low back pain

primary_outcome.measure: Lumbar multifidus muscle volume measured by MRI
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after inclusion in the study
primary_outcome.description: in patients with chronic low back pain

primary_outcome.measure: Cross-sectional area of the lumbar multifidus
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after inclusion in the study
primary_outcome.description: measured by classic 2D-ultrasound in patients with chronic low back pain and healthy controls

primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after inclusion in the study
primary_outcome.description: measured by classic 2D-ultrasound in patients with chronic low back pain and healthy controls

primary_outcome.measure: Proprioceptive postural control strategies in patients with low back pain with healthy controls
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after inclusion in the study
primary_outcome.description: Mean center-of-pressure displacement in response to soleus muscle and/or multifidus muscle vibration (60 Hz, 0.5 mm) during upright standing on two support surfaces.

arm_group.description: Individuals with non-specific chronic low back pain
Healthy individuals without low back pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria for chronic low back pain group:
- Non-specific low back pain, during 3 or more months, without radicular leg pain
- Modified Low Back Pain Disability Questionnaire > 20%
- Indication for MRI of the lumbar spine
- No contra-indications for MRI
- Informed consent to participate
Inclusion criteria for healthy control group:
- No history of low back pain needing medical treatment or resulting in limited activity level
- Any low back pain in the previous 3 months
- Informed consent to participate
Exclusion criteria for all subjects:
- Pregnancy
- Previous trauma or surgery to spine, abdomen or pelvis
- Structural deformity (e.g. scoliosis)
- Neurological/neuromuscular/systemic disease
- Inability to lie prone for 20 minutes
